riscv-boom.title:
Illegal instructions now write 0 to mtval.

In Priv 1.10, illegal instructions now write XLEN instruction bits
to the mbadaddr/mtval CSR. Writing the illegal instruction bits is
hard, but writing 0x0 is also a valid implementation.

Also add dontTouch to some signals.

Closes #45.
riscv-boom.comment: mtval may have been set to a wrong PCcould have leaked information about executed PCs.

riscv-boom.title:
[fdiv] fix NaN bug in fdiv interactions.

The hardfloat.fdiv unit treats NaN payload as dontCare bits. But in the latest
RISC-V user specification, we actually do care (as we put smaller-precision
values in the NaN payload of the larger number).

So we sanitizeNaN values coming out of the divsqrt unit.

Closes #46.
riscv-boom.comment: fdiv.d returns the wrong value.

riscv-boom.title:
Fix ecall bug in which epc was incorrectly set.

ECall demands epc be set to PC, not PC+4.
riscv-boom.comment: instruction could have been skipped when exception handler increments PC as well

rocket-chip.title:
Support corner cases in TLBPermissions

rocket-chip.comment: Support corner cases in TLBPermissions - during generation

rocket-chip.title: Fixed Hasti can't handle N masters to one slave

Fix in-register representation of fdiv.s/fsqrt.s result

We were zero-extending it, which is a double-precision zero in the recoded
format.  So, when spilled and reloaded with fsd/fld, the original value
was destroyed.  Instead, set the MSBs so that it represents sNaN.  When
spilled, the single-precision number will be preserved as the NaN payload.
rocket-chip.comment: Values changed when registers were spilled to memory and read backUnexpected data modification that could be exploited

rocket-chip.title: Use sNaN value for flw, like other single-precision ops
